lines.text: Have you lived here your whole life?
Not yet.
[last lines]

If some lives form a perfect circle, others take shape in ways we cannot predict or always understand. Loss has been a part of my journey. But it has also shown me what is precious. So has a love for which I can only be grateful.
If I was about 150 years younger, you'd be in trouble, young lady.
Choose between yesterday and tomorrow.
Teresa, I don't want to lose you.
Then don't.
And you'll just forget about me, right?
Every day.
So you *used* to be charming. Sorry I missed that.
What if you got mad at me. It's a small boat.
I don't like fighting, Theresa. Bowling either.
You look nice.
Yeah, well it hurts.
Jackets like that don't come along every week, ya know.
Got your ticket?
Of course I have my ticket. Got my name in all my underwear. And I got a quarter, for a phone call.
[first lines]

[disembarking]
Where are they?
Um... You know, they're probably just running late, they'll be here baby.
I see 'em. Daddy! Daddy!
